# Affine Space - Point vs. Vector

  • ê°œë…ì ìœ¼ë¡œ pointì™€ vectorëŠ” ë§¤ìš° ë‹¤ë¦„
  • ì´ ì°¨ì´ëŠ” homogeneous coordinatesë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
  • ì´ ê°•ì˜ì—ì„œëŠ” affine space, pointì™€ vectorì˜ ì°¨ì´ì , ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ê·¸ê²ƒì´ homogeneous coordinatesì™€ ì–´ë–»ê²Œ ì—°ê²°ë˜ëŠ”ì§€ë¥¼ í•™ìŠµí•¨
  • ì´ ê°œë…ì€ coordinate invariant ë˜ëŠ” coordinate-free geometric programmingì´ë¼ê³ ë„ ë¶ˆë¦¼

(ì¶œì²˜: http://mrl.snu.ac.kr/courses/CourseGraphics/index_2017spring.html)

# Points

  • Point $\mathbf{p}$, Point $\mathbf{q}$
  • ì´ ë‘ ì ì„ ë”í•œ "sum"ì€ ë¬´ì—‡ì¸ê°€?

# If you assume coordinates, â€¦

  • $\mathbf{p} = (x_1,~y_1)$
  • $\mathbf{q} = (x_2,~y_2)$
  • í•©: $(x_1+x_2,~y_1+y_2)$
    • ì´ê²Œ ë§ëŠ”ê°€?
    • ê¸°í•˜í•™ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì˜ë¯¸ê°€ ìˆëŠ”ê°€?
  • ë™ì¼í•œ ì¢Œí‘œ í‘œí˜„ì—ì„œ,
  • $\mathbf{p} = (x_1,~y_1)$
  • $\mathbf{q} = (x_2,~y_2)$
  • $(x_1+x_2,~y_1+y_2)$ëŠ” ë‹¨ìˆœí•œ í•©ì´ ì•„ë‹Œ,
    ì›ì ì—ì„œ $\mathbf{p}$ì™€ $\mathbf{q}$ê¹Œì§€ ê°€ëŠ” vectorì˜ í•©ìœ¼ë¡œ ê°„ì£¼í•´ì•¼ í•¨
    â†’ Vector sum

# If you select a different origin, â€¦

  • $\mathbf{p} = (x_1,~y_1)$
  • $\mathbf{q} = (x_2,~y_2)$
  • $(x_1+x_2,~y_1+y_2)$ì˜ ì˜ë¯¸ëŠ”
    ì¢Œí‘œê³„(ì›ì )ê°€ ì–´ë””ì¸ì§€ì— ë”°ë¼ ë‹¬ë¼ì§
  • ì¦‰, ë‹¤ë¥¸ coordinate frameì„ ì„ íƒí•˜ë©´ ê²°ê³¼ë„ ë‹¬ë¼ì§

# Points and Vectors

  • pointëŠ” ì¢Œí‘œê°’ìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜ëœ ìœ„ì¹˜
  • vectorëŠ” ë‘ ì  ì‚¬ì´ì˜ ì°¨ì´ë¡œ ì •ì˜ë¨
  • ì›ì ì´ ì •ì˜ë˜ì—ˆë‹¤ë©´, pointëŠ” ì›ì ì—ì„œ í•´ë‹¹ pointê¹Œì§€ì˜ vectorë¡œ í‘œí˜„ ê°€ëŠ¥
  • í•˜ì§€ë§Œ coordinate-free ê´€ì ì—ì„œëŠ” pointëŠ” vectorê°€ ì•„ë‹˜

# Points & Vectors are Different!

  • ìˆ˜í•™ì (ë˜ëŠ” ë¬¼ë¦¬ì )ìœ¼ë¡œ,
    • PointëŠ” ê³µê°„ìƒì˜ ìœ„ì¹˜
    • VectorëŠ” ê³µê°„ìƒì˜ ë³€ìœ„
  • ì‹œê°„ì— ë¹„ìœ í•˜ë©´ ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ìŒ:
    • datetimeì€ ì‹œê°„ì˜ ìœ„ì¹˜
    • durationì€ ì‹œê°„ì˜ ë³€ìœ„

# Vector and Affine Spaces

  • Vector space
    • ë²¡í„°ì™€ ê·¸ ì—°ì‚° í¬í•¨
    • ì (points)ì€ í¬í•¨í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ
  • Affine space
    • vector spaceì˜ ìƒìœ„ ê°œë…
    • ë²¡í„°, ì , ê·¸ì— ê´€ë ¨ëœ ì—°ì‚° ëª¨ë‘ í¬í•¨

# Vector spaces

  • A vector spaceëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ êµ¬ì„±ë¨:
    • ë²¡í„° ì§‘í•©ê³¼
    • ë‘ ê°€ì§€ ì—°ì‚°:
      • ë²¡í„° ê°„ ë§ì…ˆ
      • ìŠ¤ì¹¼ë¼ ê³±

# Linear Combination

  • ë²¡í„°ë“¤ì˜ ì„ í˜• ê²°í•©(linear combination) ë˜í•œ ë²¡í„°ì„

$$ \mathbf{u}_0, \mathbf{u}_1, \dots, \mathbf{u}_n \in V \\ \Rightarrow c_0 \mathbf{u}_0 + c_1 \mathbf{u}_1 + \dots + c_n \mathbf{u}_n \in V $$

# Affine Spaces

  • An affine spaceëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ êµ¬ì„±ë¨:
    • ì ë“¤ì˜ ì§‘í•©, ê´€ë ¨ëœ ë²¡í„° ê³µê°„
    • ë‘ ê°€ì§€ ì—°ì‚°:
      • ë‘ ì ì˜ ì°¨ì´
      • ì  + ë²¡í„°

# Coordinate-Free Geometric Operations

  • ë§ì…ˆ (Addition)
  • ëº„ì…ˆ (Subtraction)
  • ìŠ¤ì¹¼ë¼ ê³± (Scalar multiplication)

# Addition

  • $\mathbf{u}, \mathbf{v}, \mathbf{w}$: vectors
  • $\mathbf{p}, \mathbf{q}$: points
    ë¼ê³  í•  ë•Œ,
  • $\mathbf{u} + \mathbf{v} \rightarrow$ vector
  • $\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{w} \rightarrow$ point

# Subtraction

  • $\mathbf{u} - \mathbf{v} \rightarrow$ vector
  • $\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{q} \rightarrow$ vector
  • $\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{w} \rightarrow$ point

# Scalar Multiplication

  • ìŠ¤ì¹¼ë¼ â‹… ë²¡í„° = ë²¡í„°
    • $c \cdot \mathbf{v} \rightarrow$ vector
  • $1 \cdot$ point = point
  • $0 \cdot$ point = vector
  • $c \cdot$ point = (undefined) $~\text{if} ~(c \neq 0,~1)$

# Affine Frame

  • A frameì€ ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜ë¨:
    • ë²¡í„°ë“¤ì˜ ì§‘í•© $ \{ \mathbf{v}_i~| ~ i = 1, \dots, N \}$
    • ê¸°ì¤€ì  $\mathbf{o}$
  • ë²¡í„°ë“¤ì˜ ì§‘í•© ${\mathbf{v}_i}$ëŠ” í•´ë‹¹ vector spaceì˜ bases
  • $\mathbf{o}$ëŠ” í•´ë‹¹ frameì˜ origin
  • $N$ì€ affine spaceì˜ **dimension **
  • ì„ì˜ì˜ ì  $\mathbf{p}$ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ í‘œí˜„ë¨: $$ \mathbf{p} = \mathbf{o} + c_1 \mathbf{v}_1 + c_2 \mathbf{v}_2 + \dots + c_n \mathbf{v}_n $$
  • ì„ì˜ì˜ ë²¡í„° $\mathbf{v}$ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ í‘œí˜„ë¨: $$ \mathbf{v} = c_1 \mathbf{v}_1 + c_2 \mathbf{v}_2 + \dots + c_n \mathbf{v}_n $$

# Summary

  • Affine spaceì—ì„œ: $$ \begin{aligned} \mathbf{p} + \mathbf{p} & = \text{(undefined)} \\ \mathbf{p} - \mathbf{p} & = \text{vector} \\ \mathbf{p} \pm \mathbf{v} & = \text{point} \\ \mathbf{v} \pm \mathbf{v} & = \text{vector} \\ c \cdot \mathbf{v} & = \text{vector} \\ 1 \cdot \mathbf{p} & = \text{point} \\ 0 \cdot \mathbf{p} & = \text{vector} \\ c \cdot \mathbf{p} & = \text{(undefined)} \quad (c \neq 0, 1) \end{aligned} $$

# Points & Vectors in Homogeneous Coordinates

  • Homogeneous coordinatesì—ì„œëŠ”,
    • 3D point: $ (x, y, z, \mathbf{1}) $
    • 3D vector: $ (x, y, z, \mathbf{0}) $

â†’ ì´ í‘œí˜„ì€ coordinate-free geometric programmingì˜ ê°œë…ê³¼ ì™„ì „í•˜ê²Œ ì¼ì¹˜í•˜ëŠ” ëª¨ë¸ì„ ì œê³µí•¨

ì˜ˆì‹œ: $$ (x_1, y_1, z_1, 1) + (x_2, y_2, z_2, 1) \\= (x_1 + x_2, y_1 + y_2, z_1 + z_2, 2) \text{â†’ point (undefined)} $$

$$ (x_1, y_1, z_1, 1) - (x_2, y_2, z_2, 1) \\= (x_1 - x_2, y_1 - y_2, z_1 - z_2, 0) \text{â†’ vector} $$

$$ (x_1, y_1, z_1, 1) + (x_2, y_2, z_2, 0) \\= (x_1 + x_2, y_1 + y_2, z_1 + z_2, 1) \text{â†’ point} $$

$$ (x_1, y_1, z_1, 0) + (x_2, y_2, z_2, 0) \\= (x_1 + x_2, y_1 + y_2, z_1 + z_2, 0) \text{â†’ vector} $$

$$ c \cdot (x, y, z, 0) \\= (cx, cy, cz, 0) \text{â†’ vector} $$

$$ c \cdot (x, y, z, 1) \\= (cx, cy, cz, c) \text{â†’} \begin{cases} \text{point} & \text{if } c = 1 \\ \text{vector} & \text{if } c = 0 \\ \text{undefined} & \text{if } c \ne 0, 1 \end{cases} $$

  • Affine transformation matrixì™€ point, vectorì˜ ê³±:

$$ \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} & \mathbf{t} \\ \mathbf{0}^\mathrm{T} & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{p} \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} \mathbf{p} + \mathbf{t} \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} \text{â†’ point} $$

$$ \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} & \mathbf{t} \\ \mathbf{0}^\mathrm{T} & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{v} \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{M} \mathbf{v} \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} \text{â†’ vector} $$

â†’ translationì€ vectorì—ëŠ” ì ìš©ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ!

# Quiz 1

# Coordinate System & Reference Frame

  • Coordinate system

    • ì ì˜ ìœ„ì¹˜ë¥¼ ê³ ìœ í•˜ê²Œ ê²°ì •í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ í•˜ë‚˜ ì´ìƒì˜ ìˆ«ì ë˜ëŠ” ì¢Œí‘œë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ëŠ” ì²´ê³„

  • Reference frame

    • ì¶”ìƒì ì¸ ì¢Œí‘œê³„ + ì‹¤ì œ ê¸°ì¤€ì 
    • ì¢Œí‘œê³„ë¥¼ ê³ ì •ì‹œí‚¤ê¸° ìœ„í•´ ì‚¬ìš©ë¨

  • ì´ ë‘ ìš©ì–´ëŠ” ì¢…ì¢… í˜¼ìš©ë˜ì§€ë§Œ, ì˜ë¯¸ì—ëŠ” ì•½ê°„ì˜ ì°¨ì´ê°€ ìˆìŒ

# World / Body Frame (or Coordinate System)

  • World frame (or coordinate system)

    • ì„¸ê³„ì— ê³ ì •ëœ ì¢Œí‘œê³„
    • aka. global frame, fixed frame

  • Body frame (or coordinate system)

    • ë¬¼ì²´ì— ê³ ì •ëœ ì¢Œí‘œê³„
    • aka. local frame

# Meanings of Affine Transformation Matrix

  • í•˜ë‚˜ì˜ affine transformation matrixëŠ”
    ì—¬ëŸ¬ ê´€ì ì—ì„œ í•´ì„ ê°€ëŠ¥í•¨

# 1) Affine Transformation Matrix Transforms a Geometry w.r.t. World Frame

  • í–‰ë ¬ $\mathbf{M}$ì€ ê¸°í•˜ ê°ì²´ì˜ ê° vertex ìœ„ì¹˜ë¥¼ world frame ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ ìƒˆë¡œìš´ ìœ„ì¹˜ë¡œ ë³€í™˜

  • ë³€í™˜ í¬í•¨: translate, rotate, scale ë“±

$$ \mathbf{M} = \begin{bmatrix} m_{11} & m_{12} & m_{13} & u_x \\ m_{21} & m_{22} & m_{23} & u_y \\ m_{31} & m_{32} & m_{33} & u_z \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} $$

  • $\mathbf{M}$ì„ ê³±í•˜ë©´ geometryê°€ world frameì—ì„œ ë‹¤ë¥¸ ìœ„ì¹˜ë¡œ ì´ë™ëœ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ì–»ê²Œ ë¨

# Review: Affine Frame

  • Affine frame (3D ê³µê°„ ê¸°ì¤€)ì€ ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜ë¨:
    • $x,~y,~z$ì¶•ì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ëŠ” 3ê°œì˜ ë²¡í„°
    • 1ê°œì˜ ì›ì  ìœ„ì¹˜(ì¢Œí‘œ)

# World Frame

  • World frameì€ ë³´í†µ ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„ë¨:
    • í‘œì¤€ ì¶• ë²¡í„°
      $$ \hat{\mathbf{e}}_x = \begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix}~ \hat{\mathbf{e}}_y = \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix}~ \hat{\mathbf{e}}_z = \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 1\end{bmatrix} $$
    • ì›ì 
      $$ \mathbf{0}= \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} $$

# Letâ€™s Transform a "World Frame"

  • $\mathbf{M}$ì„ world frameì— ê³±í•˜ë©´, ê° ì¶• ë²¡í„° ë° ì›ì ì´ ë³€í™˜ë¨:

$ \text{x-axis:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} $ : ì²« ë²ˆì§¸ column

$ \text{y-axis:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} $ : ë‘ ë²ˆì§¸ column

$ \text{z-axis:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} $ : ì„¸ ë²ˆì§¸ column

$ \text{origin:} \quad \mathbf{M} \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 1\end{bmatrix} $ : ë„¤ ë²ˆì§¸ column

# 2) Affine Transformation Matrix Defines an Affine Frame w.r.t. World Frame

  • í–‰ë ¬ $\mathbf{M}$ì€ ê¸°ì¤€ í”„ë ˆì„ $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„ëœ body frame $\{1\}$ì„ ì •ì˜
  • $\mathbf{M}$ì˜ ê° columnì€ ë‹¤ìŒì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ëƒ„:
    • ì•ì˜ 3ê°œ column: ì¶• ë²¡í„°
    • ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ column: ì›ì  ìœ„ì¹˜

â†’ $\mathbf{M}$ì€ body frame $\{1\}$ì„ world frame $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•œ ê²ƒ

# Examples

  • ê°™ì€ ë¬¼ì²´ì˜ body frameì„ ë‘ ë°©ì‹ìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ì˜:
    1. world frameê³¼ ë™ì¼í•œ ìœ„ì¹˜ì¼ ë•Œ
    2. ì´ë™ëœ ìœ„ì¹˜ì—ì„œ ì •ì˜ë  ë•Œ

â†’ ë‘ ê²½ìš° ëª¨ë‘ $\mathbf{M}$ì€ body frameì„ world ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•¨

# 3) Affine Transformation Matrix Transforms a Point in Body Frame to (the same) Point (but) represented in World Frame

  • $ \mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} = \begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} $
    (body frame $\{1\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì˜ ì ) $$ \mathbf{p}^{\{0\}} = \mathbf{M} \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} $$
  • ê°™ì€ ì ì„ world frame $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•œ ê²ƒ
    Why?
  • ë™ì¼í•œ ë¬¼ì²´ë¥¼ body frameì—ì„œ ë³´ë‹¤ê°€ $\mathbf{M}$ì„ í†µí•´ world frame ê¸°ì¤€ í‘œí˜„ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•œ ê²ƒ: $$ \mathbf{p}^{\{0\}} = \mathbf{M} \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} $$
  • ë‹¨ìˆœíˆ geometryë¥¼ ë³€í™˜í•œ ì´ì•¼ê¸°ì„

# Directions of the "arrow"

  • ì²« ë²ˆì§¸ ì˜ë¯¸
    • geometry ìì²´ë¥¼ transform (frameì€ ê·¸ëŒ€ë¡œ)
    • $\mathbf{M}$ì€ ë³€í™˜ì˜ ë°©í–¥ì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ëƒ„: ${\{0\}}\rightarrow{\{1\}}$
      â†’ $\mathbf{p}^{\{0\}}$ê°€ ë³€í™˜ë˜ì–´ $\mathbf{p}^{\{1\}}$ì´ ë¨.
  • ë‘ ë²ˆì§¸ ì˜ë¯¸
    • frame ìì²´ì˜ ë³€í™˜
    • ${\{1\}}$ í”„ë ˆì„ì´ ${\{0\}}$ ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ ì–´ë–»ê²Œ ë³´ì´ëŠ”ì§€ë¥¼ ë‚˜íƒ€ëƒ„
  • ì„¸ ë²ˆì§¸ ì˜ë¯¸
    • $\mathbf{p}$ë¼ëŠ” ì ì´ í‘œí˜„ë˜ëŠ” í”„ë ˆì„ ìì²´ë¥¼ ë°”ê¾¸ëŠ” ê³¼ì • â†’ "í‘œí˜„ì˜ ê¸°ì¤€"ì´ ë°”ë€œ: $\{0\}$ì—ì„œ ë³¸ $\mathbf{p}$ë¥¼ $\{1\}$ì—ì„œ ë³¸ $\mathbf{p}$ë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒ

# Quiz 2

# All these concepts work even if the starting frame is not world frame!

  • ì‹œì‘ í”„ë ˆì„ì´ world frameì´ ì•„ë‹ˆì–´ë„, ì§€ê¸ˆê¹Œì§€ì˜ ëª¨ë“  ê°œë…ì€ ê·¸ëŒ€ë¡œ ì ìš© ê°€ëŠ¥

# {0} to {1}

  • $\mathbf{M}_1$ì€ ë‹¤ìŒì„ ìˆ˜í–‰:
    1. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ geometryë¥¼ ë³€í™˜
    2. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ í”„ë ˆì„ $\{1\}$ì„ ì •ì˜
    3. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{1\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì˜ ì ì„ $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„
      $$ \mathbf{p}^{\{0\}} = \mathbf{M}_1 \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} $$

# {1} to {2}

  • $\mathbf{M}_2$ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒì„ ìˆ˜í–‰:
    1. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{1\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ geometryë¥¼ ë³€í™˜
    2. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{1\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ í”„ë ˆì„ ë¥¼ ì •ì˜
    3. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{2\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì˜ ì ì„ $\{1\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„
      $$ \mathbf{p}^{\{1\}} = \mathbf{M}_2 \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{2\}} $$

# {0} to {2}

  • $\mathbf{M}_1 \mathbf{M}_2$ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒì„ ìˆ˜í–‰:
    1. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ geometryë¥¼ ë³€í™˜
    2. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ í”„ë ˆì„ $\{2\}$ë¥¼ ì •ì˜
    3. í”„ë ˆì„ $\{2\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ì˜ ì ì„ $\{0\}$ ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ í‘œí˜„
      $$ \mathbf{p}^{\{0\}} = \mathbf{M}_1 \cdot \mathbf{M}_2 \cdot \mathbf{p}^{\{2\}} $$

# Revisit: Order Matters!

  • $\mathbf{T}, \mathbf{R}$ì´ affine transformationì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ëŠ” í–‰ë ¬ì¼ ë•Œ: $$ \mathbf{p}' = \mathbf{T} \cdot \mathbf{R} \cdot \mathbf{p} \\\Rightarrow \text{ ë¨¼ì € } \mathbf{R}(\mathbf{p}) \text{ ì ìš©, ê·¸ í›„ } \mathbf{T} $$ $$ \mathbf{p}' = \mathbf{R} \cdot \mathbf{T} \cdot \mathbf{p} \\\Rightarrow \text{ ë¨¼ì € } \mathbf{T}(\mathbf{p}) \text{ ì ìš©, ê·¸ í›„ } \mathbf{R} $$
  • â†’ í–‰ë ¬ì˜ ê³±ì…ˆ ìˆœì„œëŠ” ë§¤ìš° ì¤‘ìš”í•¨!
    • ê²°í•©ë²•ì¹™ì€ ì„±ë¦½í•˜ì§€ë§Œ êµí™˜ë²•ì¹™ì€ ì„±ë¦½í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ: $AB \ne BA$

# Composite(ë³µí•©) Transformationsì˜ Interpretation(í•´ì„)

  • ì˜ˆì‹œ transformation:
    $$ \mathbf{M} = \mathbf{T}(x,~3) \cdot \mathbf{R}(-90^\circ) $$
  • ì§€ê¸ˆê¹Œì§€ í•´ì„í–ˆë˜ ë°©ì‹:
    • $\mathbf{R} \rightarrow \mathbf{T}$ ìˆœì„œë¡œ ì ìš©
    • $\mathbf{R}$ì€ world frame ê¸°ì¤€ ë³€í™˜ $$ \mathbf{p} \xrightarrow{\mathbf{R}(-90^\circ)} \mathbf{R}(\mathbf{p}) \\\xrightarrow{\mathbf{T}(x, 3)} \mathbf{p}' = \mathbf{T}(\mathbf{R}(\mathbf{p})) $$
  • ë‹¤ë¥¸ í•´ì„ ë°©ì‹:
    • $\mathbf{R} \rightarrow \mathbf{T}$ ìˆœì„œê°€ ì•„ë‹Œ, $\mathbf{T} \rightarrow \mathbf{R}$ ìˆœì„œë¡œ í•´ì„
    • ì¦‰, body frame ê¸°ì¤€ì—ì„œ í•´ì„í•˜ëŠ” ë°©ì‹ $$ \mathbf{p} \rightarrow \mathbf{T}(\mathbf{p}) \rightarrow \mathbf{R}(\mathbf{T}(\mathbf{p})) = \mathbf{M}(\mathbf{p}) = \mathbf{p}' $$ â†’ ë™ì¼í•œ í–‰ë ¬ì´ë¼ë„ ê¸°ì¤€ í”„ë ˆì„ì— ë”°ë¼ í•´ì„ì´ ë‹¬ë¼ì§ˆ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ

# Pre-(left) & Post-(right) Multiplication

# Pre-multiplication:

$$ \mathbf{p}' = \mathbf{M}_1 \cdot \mathbf{M}_2 \cdot \mathbf{p} \\ (\text{pre-multiplication by } \mathbf{M}_1) $$

â†’ Right-to-Left ìˆœì„œ

  1. $\mathbf{M}_2$ë¥¼ world frame ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ ì ìš©í•˜ì—¬ $\mathbf{p}$ë¥¼ ë³€í™˜
  2. ê·¸ ê²°ê³¼ì— $\mathbf{M}_1$ì„ ë‹¤ì‹œ world frame ê¸°ì¤€ìœ¼ë¡œ ì ìš©

â†’ ì „ì²´ ë³€í™˜ì€ $\mathbf{M}_1 \mathbf{M}_2$

# Post-multiplication:

$$ \mathbf{p}' = \mathbf{M}_1 \cdot \mathbf{M}_2 \cdot \mathbf{p} \\ (\text{post-multiplication by } \mathbf{M}_1) $$
